title: Hybrid Transducer and Attention based Encoder-Decoder Modeling for Speech-to-Text Tasks. (arXiv:2305.03101v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Transducer and Attention based Encoder-Decoder (AED) are two widely used frameworks for speech-to-text tasks. They are designed for different purposes and each has its own benefits and drawbacks for speech-to-text tasks. In order to leverage strengths of both modeling methods, we propose a solution by combining Transducer and Attention based Encoder-Decoder (TAED) for speech-to-text tasks. The new method leverages AED's strength in non-monotonic sequence to sequence learning while retaining Transducer's streaming property. In the proposed framework, Transducer and AED share the same speech encoder. The predictor in Transducer is replaced by the decoder in the AED model, and the outputs of the decoder are conditioned on the speech inputs instead of outputs from an unconditioned language model. translated_title: 混合变换器和注意力编码器-解码器模型用于语音到文本任务
translated_abstract: 变换器和注意力编码器-解码器（AED）是用于语音到文本任务的两种广泛使用的框架。 它们针对不同的目的进行设计，每种方法在语音到文本任务中都有其优点和缺点。为了利用两种建模方法的优势，我们提出了一种通过结合变换器和注意力编码器-解码器（TAED）处理语音到文本任务的解决方案。该新方法利用了AED中关于非单调序列到序列学习的优势，同时保留了变换器的流式属性。在所提出的框架中，变换器和AED共享同一个语音编码器。变换器中的预测器被AED模型中的解码器所取代，解码器的输出是基于语音输入而不是基于无条件的语言模型输出的。所提出的解决方案确保了通过涵盖所有可能的读取/写入场景来优化模型，并为流式应用程序创造了匹配的环境。我们对所提出的方法进行了评估。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种结合了变换器和AED框架的新方案，利用AED的序列到序列学习的优势，同时保留了变换器的流式属性，旨在提高语音到文本任务的性能。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new solution for speech-to-text tasks by combining the strengths of the Transducer and Attention based Encoder-Decoder models, aiming to improve performance by leveraging the non-monotonic sequence to sequence learning of AED and retaining the streaming property of Transducer.
